post: Hi guys! You can call me malcolm. I was working for a major telecomms service provider company in Uganda rendering services to telecom companies like Airtel UG, MTN, Huawei, and Ericsson. These services included commissioning and decommissioning of telecommunication equipment on sites (mulongoti) all over the country; including packaging and transportation of the said telecom equipment. I was handling the IT section. I left the company after it delayed paying employees' salar...ies due to delays like invoicing, acceptance...and the rest. The thing is, I then hijacked their most valued source of information/data until they paid me. Which they did but they paid me less (1.2m) and failed to clear till now. I then re-hijacked it again until they got fed up! So they opened a new business email. Now this valuable source of info (biz email) was where they communicated with Ericsson, Airtel....and the rest and it includes all their business communications, contacts, contracts & agreements including the general workflow of the business. Thing is, I hav no use for it anymore and anyone here who may see use in this data may inbox me such that I find a way to dispose of it. It may be very much useful for those doing mass communication/telecommunication engineering coz we all know how complicated that stuff is; but this data makes it easy to understand. Be it site links, making quotations, pricebooks, invoices...how to deal with URA, contacts of all ASPs....EVERYTHING!

Uganda ABOUT AIRTEL UGANDA Home > personal > About Us > Company Overview > About Airtel Uganda airtel was launched in Uganda in June 2010 and is Uganda’s most innovative mobile phone operator, which has introduced many “firsts” in the telecommunications sector. As a mobile operator airtel introduced affordable communication products and services that have transformed millions of Ugandans and businesses. History of the airtel in Uganda; CELTEL Uganda was the first Telecommunication Company in Uganda that was introduced in 1995 and transformed telephony by connecting people with the use of a mobile phone. In July 2007 CELTEL Uganda changed its brand name to ZAIN Uganda that was eventually changed to airtel Uganda in 2010 thus joining a family of over 260 million subscribers in Africa, India and Indonesia. BRAND VALUES; Empowerment; We respect the opinions and decisions of others. We encourage and back people to do their best. Entrepreneurship; We always strive to change the status quo. We Innovate with new ideas and energize with a strong passion and entrepreneurial spirit. Transparency: We believe we must work with honesty, trust and the innate desire to do good. Impact: We are driven by the desire to create a meaningful difference in society. Flexibility: We are ever willing to learn and adapt to the environment, our partners and the customer’s evolving needs. Our BRAND PROMISE; We will be brave, bold and boundary-less in meeting the emerging needs of our customers. We promise innovative and locally relevant solutions which simplify and delight. airtel Uganda is indeed a great success story having acquired Warid Telecom in May 2013 and growing to a family of 7.2 Million Customers and investing heavily in network expansion and Innovative IT Systems all in a bid to ensure clear network coverage and excellent customer experience.

post: ‪#‎PopeInUganda‬ Full Text of Pope Francis' Address to the Youth at Kololo Airstrip All of you, be aware, be aware that you are a people of martyrs. Through your own veins runs the blood of martyrs, and that's why you have such a strong faith and life that you enjoy now. In order to live, we have to die...but, through that death, there is light for all. A wall can be transformed into a path towards the future. There's always the possibility of opening a door, a horizon to the... future, and to open it through the Power of Jesus. Winnie transformed her depression and bad experiences into hope. This isn't magic. This is the work of Jesus Christ, because Jesus is Lord. Jesus can do everything. Jesus had experienced the greatest sufferings in history, having been “insulted, rejected, and murdered,” but was Risen from the dead. He can do the same in us with every single thing that we experience, because Jesus is Lord. A light is like a seed. In order to live, we have to die. And dying sometimes like Emmanuel's friends – Dying as Charles Lwanga died, and the martyrs – but, through that death there is light for all. If I can transform the negative into positive, I am triumphant in the Lord. But, that can only be done with the grace of Jesus Christ. Are you ready in life to transform all your negative experiences into positive ones? Are you ready to transform hate into love? Are you ready to transform war into peace? When we're not working properly (like the microphone), who do we have to turn to for help? Jesus! He can tear down all the walls that lie before you. When we have a problem, the first thing we can do is go to our mother. Pray to Mary, our mother. Pray to the Lord Jesus, because he is the only Lord. In the Church, we are not orphans, because we have Mary our mother. Picture Credit & Copy Credit: CNA

post: ‪#‎PopeInUganda‬  24 year-old Winnie Nansumba was born, and is living with HIV. She lost both her parents when she was barely seven years-old.  As a young woman, she’s always found it hard to fall in love because she felt she didn’t have a right to love and be loved. She was always afraid of explaining her life.  Reflecting on Winnie's testimony, the Pope explained that Jesus can perform “great miracles” in life.... “A wall can be transformed into a path towards the future,” he said. “There's always the possibility of opening a door, a horizon to the future, and to open it through the Power of Jesus.” Picture Credit: Urban TV

post: ‪#‎PopeInUganda‬ Emmanuel Odokonyero – took to the microphone to tell the Pope of his tribulations with conflict. Emmanuel was among 41 students who were abducted by the Lord’s Resistance Army in May 2003 from the Sacred Heart Minor Seminary, Lacor. Some of our friends were murdered… I was tortured and they tied my hands behind my back and I failed to breathe. I wanted to ask to be killed than to suffer such a pain. They then untied me and warned me not to escape. By God’s gr...ace, I managed to escape on 11th August 2003 from Namokora Sub-county, Kitgum District. Odokonyero is a testament that despite the ache he underwent, one can overcome – he did not give up and managed to go back to school where he graduated with a degree in Business Administration.  Picture Credit: Zenit Español
